author: newsroom@capegazette.com (Staff)
title: Beacon soccer falls to Laurel 3-2
text:
Beacon soccer falls to Laurel 3-2 Oct 15, 2015 Photo by: Dan Cook Beacon Middle School's Laric Swallow takes a penalty kick in the second half that just missed the top corner of the cage. 
The Beacon Middle School Vikings hosted a very skilled Laurel soccer squad Oct. 14 and played head-to-head and kick-to-kick before falling 3-2 to the visiting Bulldogs. 
Laurel struck first and went into halftime up 3-0, but the Vikings turned up the heat in the second half with scores from Laric Swallow and Hunter Simmons. The clock was not Beacon's friend as time ran out on an intense offensive show before the Vikings could tie the score. 
In "B" team action, Beacon dominated the Bulldogs 4-0. Beacon's Jakob Gelof, left, and Laurel's Isai Flores battle for the ball in the midfield. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Beacon defender Mike Frederick clears the ball from the Vikings' defensive zone. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Beacon's Danio Somoza makes a back pass to a teammate in the midfield. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Beacon's Hunter Simmons, right, controls the ball from Laurel's Leonard Gustin. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Beacon's Ethan Shuttleworth speeds the ball upfield from Laurel's Brennan Harrington during the "B" team's 4-0 win over the Bulldogs "B" squad. (Photo by: Dan Cook)
